FMDV type O (O/MYA98/BY/2010) strain was used for viral challenge. cells were seeded into each well of a 96-well plate containing 100 L of complete medium. cells were incubated with 100 L of mizoribine at various concentrations (6, 12, 25, 50, 75, and 100 M) inhibition rate was calculated as follows: inhibition rate = (optical density of mizoribine group optical density of VC)/(optical density of cell control group optical density of VC) 100%. the viral 2B mRNA was analyzed using Q-PCR. -2 cells were extracted using TRizol reagent, and 1 g of RNA was used in reverse transcription reaction using a reagent kit containing gDNA Eraser. amplification conditions were as follows: 95 °C for 30 s, followed by 40 cycles of 95 °C for 5 s, 56 °C for 30 s, and 72 °C for 30 s. the cells were incubated with 100 TCID50 FMDV for 1 h. mizoribine diluted at indicated concentrations was added to the cells. after 12 h of incubation, the cells were washed thrice with PBS. the suckling mice were euthanized and processed for histological and immunohistochemical investigations. at 34 h post-infection, the heart tissues were fixed in 4% paraformaldehyde solution, embedded in paraffin. IBRS-2 (swine kidney cell line) cells were preserved in our laboratory. the cells were cultured in complete Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium. the cells were maintained in 5% CO2 at 37 °C. laboratory animals Thirty-two (32) two- and three-day-old BALB/c mice weighing 3–4 g were used to investigate the efficacy of mizoribine in vivo. the cytotoxicity of mizoribine was evaluated using MTS assay. the cells were seeded in 96-well plates infected with 100 TCID50 FMDV O/MY98/BY/2010 at 37 °C for 1 h. a 75 M portion of mizoribine supplemented with serial dilutions of guanosine (from 100 to 25 M) was added and incubated for 48 h. the expression levels of FMDV 2B mRNA and VP1 protein in the cells were determined by real-time PCR as previously reported. the total RNA from the IBRS-2 cells was extracted using TRizol reagent, and 1 g of RNA was used in reverse transcription reaction. the membranes were incubated with goat anti-mouse and anti-rabbit conjugated with horseradish peroxidase for 1 h at room temperature and examined by PierceTM ECL Western Blotting Substrate. indirect immunofluorescence assay (IFA) was performed as previously described with minor modifications. three-day-old Kunming suckling mice were inoculated with 50 g of mizoribine dissolved in 10 M DMSO, 5% Tween 80, and 0.1 mL of PBS by subcutaneous neck injection. after 2 h, viral challenge was performed by intradermal injection with 100 50% lethal dose (LD50) Statistical Analysis All the data are expressed as mean standard deviation (SD) for at least three independent experiments. one-way ANOVA was used to analyze the difference between mizoribine and control groups.
